alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 10:33AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Expect flooding caused by rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Montana, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 AM MDT, emergency management reported minor flooding in the advisory area due to snowmelt and rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. The Yaak River will continue to rise and reach minor flood stage this evening (Saturday). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
